div.p: From Henry Barkly to Frederick McCoy
Unit 2, pp. 2-3, VPRS 1092 Governor's letter books, VA 466 Governor of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.
I shall be happy to see you about the meteorites and to prevent your calling in vain at this place will name any hour that may suit you between 12 & 4 on Thursday next.

What I want however is some written document that I can send to professor Maskelyne as a reply to his request that the arrangement entered into between Dr Mueller and yourself should be carried out without further delay.

This is scarcely furnished me by the proof you send that the Government designed nine months ago to appoint a Commission to enquire as to the contemplated removal of the Bruce meteorite from the Colony.

The very fact of that idea having fallen to the ground, & of the subsequent abandonment of the proposed deputation from the royal Society on the subject,
Explain.
tried to prove that on finding Mr b ruce
James Bruce. as the owner had decided on the course to be pursued in regard to it, it was clearly perceived by all parties that interference with his wishes was as much out of the question, as it would have been in the case of the discoverers of the Welcome nugget.

Perhaps you will consult with Dr Mueller before you call, & bring me your joint decision as to the reply to be given to professor m aseklyn whose letter I shall be glad to receive back from you before the mail closes.
